bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR REDEEMING REWARDS ASSOCIATED WITH ACCOUNTS

abstract.p: Among other things, the present invention provides systems and methods for fulfilling reward redemptions. In some cases, the systems and methods receive redemption requests associated with an account. The redemption request can be satisfied from a reward associated with the account, or by accessing a reward associated with another account. Redeeming a reward from another account can involve transferring value from one account to another, or grouping the related accounts and allowing members of the group to perform the settlement function. Various of the systems and method further provide for performing automatic reward redemptions, either by an entity maintaining the account to which the reward is associated, or through use of a fulfillment entity.

Method for linking accounts corresponding to different products together to create a group

abstract.p: Published without an

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHOD FOR LINKING ACCOUNTS CORRESPONDING TO DIFFERENT PRODUCTS TOGETHER TO CREATE A GROUP
PROCEDE PERMETTANT DE RELIER DES COMPTES CORRESPONDANTS A DES PRODUITS DIFFERENTS AFIN DE CREER UN GROUPE

abstract.p: Linking accounts corresponding to different products together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. The method links the accounts into a group by linking a financial record for each account to group master data for the group. The group master data includes information about the group, including group parameters and a group identifier. A group typically includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationship between a dependent account and the group is specified by a dependent strategy. A dependent strategy specifies group level processing options for the account. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders.

abstract.p: Published without an

bibliographic-data.invention-title: MULTIPLE CREDIT LINE PRESENTATION INSTRUMENT
INSTRUMENT DE PRESENTATION DE LIGNES DE CREDIT MULTIPLES

abstract.p: The present invention provides systems and methods for consummating transactions realized using credit cards and other types of presentation instruments. The methods can include, inter alia, identifying a presentation instrument associated with a transaction request. Such a presentation instrument is associated with at least two underlying accounts, and it is determined the proportion in which to apply the amount of the transaction request to the underlying accounts. The systems can include various hardware and software used to implement this and other methods.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Developer for photopolymerizable presensitized plate for use in making lithographic printing plate and method for preparing lithographic printing plate
Entwickler für eine fotopolymerisierbare vorsensibilisierte Druckplatte, Verwendung dieses Entwicklers zur Herstellung von Flachdruckplatten und Verfahren zur Herstellung dieser Flachdruckplatten
Dévelopateur pour plaque présensibilisée photopolymerizable, utilisation du dévelopateur dans la fabrication de plaques d'impressions lithographiques et procédé de fabrication de ces plaques

nplcit.text: DATABASE WPI Section Ch, Week 200023 Derwent Publications Ltd., London, GB; Class A89, AN 2000-261429 XP002218012 & JP 2000 066415 A (NIPPON GOSEI GOMU KK), 3 March 2000 (2000-03-03)
DATABASE WPI Section PQ, Week 199438 Derwent Publications Ltd., London, GB; Class P84, AN 1994-305706 XP002218013 & JP 06 230582 A (KONICA CORP), 19 August 1994 (1994-08-19)
DATABASE WPI Section Ch, Week 199113 Derwent Publications Ltd., London, GB; Class G07, AN 1991-092303 XP002218014 & JP 03 038647 A (KONICA CORP), 19 February 1991 (1991-02-19)
DATABASE WPI Section Ch, Week 199008 Derwent Publications Ltd., London, GB; Class A89, AN 1990-054335 XP002218015 & JP 02 007055 A (KONICA CORP), 11 January 1990 (1990-01-11)
DATABASE WPI Section Ch, Week 198942 Derwent Publications Ltd., London, GB; Class A21, AN 1989-303868 XP002218016 & JP 01 223447 A (KONICA CORP), 6 September 1989 (1989-09-06)
- "Encyclopedia of Polymer Science and Engineering", 1985, John Wiley & Sonss, New York, USA ISBN: 0-471-89540-7 vol. 1 * page 228 *

abstract.p: A developer for a photopolymerizable presensitized plate for use in making a lithographic printing plate characterized in that it comprises an alkali silicate and a nonionic compound represented by the following general formula (I), it has a molar ratio: SiO2/M2O (wherein M represents an alkali metal or an ammonium group) ranging from 0.75 to 4.0, a pH value ranging from 11.5 to 12.8 and a conductivity ranging from 3 to 30 mS/cm: <DF NUM="(I)">A-W </DF> wehrein A represents a hydrophobic organic group whose logP as determined for A-H is not less than 1.5 and W represents a nonionic hydrophilic organic group whose logP as determined for W-H is less than 1.0

a method for preparing a lithographic printing plate comprising the steps of imagewise exposing, to light, a presensitized plate for use in making a lithographic printing plate, which comprises a substrate provided thereon with a photopolymerizable light-sensitive layer containing a compound having at least one addition-polymerizable ethylenically unsaturated double bond and a photopolymerization initiator
and then developing the exposed presensitized plate using the above developer.

The developers and the method for making a lithographic printing plate according to the present invention can prevent scumming during printing and simultaneously attain sufficient printing durability without impairment of image-forming performance, and the developer can dissolve or disperse stably for a long period of time the compounds which are not soluble in the developer, and therefore the running performance of the developer can be excellent and stabilized. <IMAGE>

bibliographic-data.invention-title: DEVELOPING SOLUTION FOR PHOTOSENSITIVE PLANOGRAPHIC PRINTING PLATE AND PLATE MAKING METHOD FOR PLANOGRAPHIC PRINTING PLATE

abstract.p: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a developing solution for a photosensitive planographic printing plate capable of ensuring both no stain in printing and printing resistance without impairing image forming property, capable of dissolving a developing-solution-insoluble compound or stabilizing the compound in a dispersed state over a long time and capable of also improving processing stability and to provide a plate making method for a planographic printing plate. SOLUTION: The developing solution for a photopolymerizable photosensitive planographic printing plate contains an alkali silicate and a nonionic compound of the formula A-W (where A is a hydrophobic organic group, logP of A-H is >=1.5, W is a nonionic hydrophilic organic group and 1ogP of W-H is <1.0) and has an SiO2 to M2 O molar ratio (M is an alkali metal) of 0.75-4.0, pH 11.5-12.8 and 3-30 mS/cm electric conductivity.

In the plate making method, a photosensitive planographic printing plate having a photopolymerizable photosensitive layer containing a compound having at least one addition polymerizable ethylenically unsaturated double bond and a photopolymerization initiator on a support is exposed and developed with the developing solution.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Developer for photopolymerizable presensitized plate for use in making lithographic printing plate and method for preparing lithographic printing plate

abstract.p: A developer for a photopolymerizable presensitized plate for use in making a lithographic printing plate characterized in that it comprises an alkali silicate and a nonionic compound represented by the following general formula (I), it has a molar ratio: SiO2/M2O (wherein M represents an alkali metal or an ammonium group) ranging from 0.75 to 4.0, a pH value ranging from 11.5 to 12.8 and a conductivity ranging from 3 to 30 mS/cm:A-W (I)wherein A represents a hydrophobic organic group whose logP as determined for A-H is not less than 1.5 and W represents a nonionic hydrophilic organic group whose logP as determined for W-H is less than 1.0

a method for preparing a lithographic printing plate comprising the steps of imagewise exposing, to light, a presensitized plate for use in making a lithographic printing plate, which comprises a substrate provided thereon with a photopolymerizable light-sensitive layer containing a compound having at least one addition-polymerizable ethylenically unsaturated double bond and a photopolymerization initiator
and then developing the exposed presensitized plate using the above developer.

The developers and the method for making a lithographic printing plate according to the present invention can prevent scumming during printing and simultaneously attain sufficient printing durability without impairment of image-forming performance, and the developer can dissolve or disperse stably for a long period of time the compounds which are not soluble in the developer, and therefore the running performance of the developer can be excellent and stabilized.

abstract.p: A developer for a photopolymerizable presensitized plate for use in making a lithographic printing plate characterized in that it comprises an alkali silicate and a nonionic compound represented by the following general formula (I), it has a molar ratio: SiO2/M2O (wherein M represents an alkali metal or an ammonium group) ranging from 0.75 to 4.0, a pH value ranging from 11.5 to 12.8 and a conductivity ranging from 3 to 30 mS/cm:wherein A represents a hydrophobic organic group whose logP as determined for A-H is not less than 1.5 and W represents a nonionic hydrophilic organic group whose logP as determined for W-H is less than 1.0

a method for preparing a lithographic printing plate comprising the steps of imagewise exposing, to light, a presensitized plate for use in making a lithographic printing plate, which comprises a substrate provided thereon with a photopolymerizable light-sensitive layer containing a compound having at least one addition-polymerizable ethylenically unsaturated double bond and a photopolymerization initiator
and then developing the exposed presensitized plate using the above developer.

The developers and the method for making a lithographic printing plate according to the present invention can prevent scumming during printing and simultaneously attain sufficient printing durability without impairment of image-forming performance, and the developer can dissolve or disperse stably for a long period of time the compounds which are not soluble in the developer, and therefore the running performance of the developer can be excellent and stabilized.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Method for linking accounts corresponding to different products together to create a group

nplcit.text: White, Ron, How Computers Work, 3rd Ed. Que Corporation, Sep. 1998

abstract.p: Linking accounts corresponding to different products together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. The method links the accounts into a group by linking a financial record for each account to group master data for the group. The group master data includes information about the group, including group parameters and a group identifier. A group typically includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationship between a dependent account and the group is specified by a dependent strategy. A dependent strategy specifies group level processing options for the account. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Methods for processing a group of accounts corresponding to different products

abstract.p: Processing a group of accounts corresponding to different products. A group of accounts are linked together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. Typically, a group includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders. Group level processing includes authorizing transactions, applying group payments, creating group statements, creating cardholder communications, and administering reward programs. Each dependent account has an associated dependent strategy that specifies group level processing options for the dependent account.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Method for defining a relationship between an account and a group

nplcit.text: - Air Miles Reward Program; "Terms and Conditions of the Air Miles Reward Program"; May 1998

abstract.p: Defining a relationship between an account and a group. Accounts corresponding to different products are linked together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. The relationship between a dependent account and the group is specified by a dependent strategy. A dependent strategy specifies group level processing options for the account. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR REDEEMING REWARDS ASSOCIATED WITH ACCOUNTS

abstract.p: Among other things, the present invention provides systems and methods for fulfilling reward redemptions. In some cases, the systems and methods receive redemption requests associated with an account. The redemption request can be satisfied from a reward associated with the account, or by accessing a reward associated with another account. Redeeming a reward from another account can involve transferring value from one account to another, or grouping the related accounts and allowing members of the group to perform the settlement function. Various of the systems and method further provide for performing automatic reward redemptions, either by an entity maintaining the account to which the reward is associated, or through use of a fulfillment entity.

abstract.p: Among other things, the present invention provides systems and methods for fulfilling reward redemptions. In some cases, the systems and methods receive redemption requests associated with an account. The redemption request can be satisfied from a reward associated with the account, or by accessing a reward associated with another account. Redeeming a reward from another account can involve transferring value from one account to another, or grouping the related accounts and allowing members of the group to perform the settlement function. Various of the systems and method further provide for performing automatic reward redemptions, either by an entity maintaining the account to which the reward is associated, or through use of a fulfillment entity.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: CHASING REWARDS ASSOCIATED WITH ACCOUNTS

abstract.p: The present invention is directed to a method for linking accounts corresponding to different products together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. The method links the accounts into a group by linking a financial record for each account to group master data for the group. The group master data includes information about the group, including group control settings, aggregate data, and a group identifier. A group typically includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationship between a dependent account and the group is specified by a dependent strategy. A dependent strategy specifies group level processing options for the account.

The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders. Alternative embodiments will be apparent to those skilled in the art to which the present invention pertains without departing from its spirit and scope. Accordingly, the scope of the present invention is described by the appended claims and is supported by the foregoing description.

abstract.p: The present invention is directed to a method for linking accounts corresponding to different products together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. The method links the accounts into a group by linking a financial record for each account to group master data for the group. The group master data includes information about the group, including group control settings, aggregate data, and a group identifier. A group typically includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationship between a dependent account and the group is specified by a dependent strategy. A dependent strategy specifies group level processing options for the account.

The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders. Alternative embodiments will be apparent to those skilled in the art to which the present invention pertains without departing from its spirit and scope. Accordingly, the scope of the present invention is described by the appended claims and is supported by the foregoing description.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Systems and methods for accessing and modifying usage parameters associated with a financial transaction account

abstract.p: Systems and methods for providing access to usage parameters associated with financial transaction accounts. Such can include providing an account and one or more usage parameters associated therewith. Further, a request to modify one or more of the usage parameters is received, and the modification is implemented.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Authorizing transactions associated with accounts

abstract.p: The present invention is directed to a method for linking accounts corresponding to different products together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. The method links the accounts into a group by linking a financial record for each account to group master data for the group. The group master data includes information about the group, including group control settings, aggregate data, and a group identifier. A group typically includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationship between a dependent account and the group is specified by a dependent strategy. A dependent strategy specifies group level processing options for the account. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders. Alternative embodiments will be apparent to those skilled in the art to which the present invention pertains without departing from its spirit and scope. Accordingly, the scope of the present invention is described by the appended claims and is supported by the foregoing description.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Pooling rewards associated with accounts

abstract.p: The present invention is directed to a method for linking accounts corresponding to different products together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. The method links the accounts into a group by linking a financial record for each account to group master data for the group. The group master data includes information about the group, including group control settings, aggregate data, and a group identifier. A group typically includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationship between a dependent account and the group is specified by a dependent strategy. A dependent strategy specifies group level processing options for the account. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders. Alternative embodiments will be apparent to those skilled in the art to which the present invention pertains without departing from its spirit and scope. Accordingly, the scope of the present invention is described by the appended claims and is supported by the foregoing description.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: System and methods for redeeming rewards associated with accounts

abstract.p: Among other things, the present invention provides systems and methods for fulfilling reward redemptions. In some cases, the systems and methods receive redemption requests associated with an account. The redemption request can be satisfied from a reward associated with the account, or by accessing a reward associated with another account. Redeeming a reward from another account can involve transferring value from one account to another, or grouping the related accounts and allowing members of the group to perform the settlement function. Various of the systems and method further provide for performing automatic reward redemptions, either by an entity maintaining the account to which the reward is associated, or through use of a fulfillment entity.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Chasing rewards associated with accounts

abstract.p: The present invention is directed to a method for linking accounts corresponding to different products together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. The method links the accounts into a group by linking a financial record for each account to group master data for the group. The group master data includes information about the group, including group control settings, aggregate data, and a group identifier. A group typically includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationship between a dependent account and the group is specified by a dependent strategy. A dependent strategy specifies group level processing options for the account. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders. Accordingly, the scope of the present invention is described by the appended claims and is supported by the foregoing description.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Systems and methods for authorizing transactions

abstract.p: Among other things, the present invention provides systems and methods for authorizing transactions. The methods include receiving a transaction request, determining if one or more of a velocity limit, a geographic limit, a merchant limit, and/or the like. These determined limit(s) are then used to authorize the transaction request. Other methods provide a mechanism for defining limits in relation to one or more entities. The systems include various components useful in implementing the disclosed methods.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Financial transaction account usage parameter access and control method

abstract.p: A methodology for access, control and management of credit product usage parameters by an account holder. The methodology includes the steps of creating a credit/debit account and issuing a credit/debit card product for same. A group or family of accounts can optionally be created including a key account and one or more dependent accounts. An initially set of product usage parameters is established. The account holder access the product usage parameters through one of a number of alternative points of access. The account holder then modifies one or more of the product usage parameters and submits the same, optionally in real time. The submitted parameters are tested against allowable usage criteria implemented by the card processing and service provider or the card issuer, which can be based on applicable laws, rules and regulations. If the submitted usage parameter modifications are acceptable, same are implemented and control the product usage until further modified. In a group or family context the usage parameters can be specifically established for a key account and optionally, one or more dependent accounts. Optionally the dependent accounts in such a group can be provided with access, control and management over certain usage parameters.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Multiple credit line presentation instrument

abstract.p: The present invention provides systems and methods for consummating transactions realized using credit cards and other types of presentation instruments. The methods can include, inter alia, identifying a presentation instrument associated with a transaction request. Such a presentation instrument is associated with at least two underlying accounts, and it is determined the proportion in which to apply the amount of the transaction request to the underlying accounts. The systems can include various hardware and software used to implement this and other methods.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Developer for photopolymerizable presensitized plate for use in making lithographic printing plate

abstract.p: A developer for a photopolymerizable presensitized plate for use in making a lithographic printing plate characterized in that it comprises an alkali silicate and a nonionic compound represented by the following general formula (I), it has a molar ratio: SiO2/M2O (wherein M represents an alkali metal or an ammonium group) ranging from 0.75 to 4.0, a pH value ranging from 11.5 to 12.8 and a conductivity ranging from 3 to 30 mS/cm: <?in-line-formulae description="In-line Formulae" end="lead"?>A-W (I) <?in-line-formulae description="In-line Formulae" end="tail"?> wherein A represents a hydrophobic organic group whose logP as determined for A-H is not less than 1.5 and W represents a nonionic hydrophilic organic group whose logP as determined for W-H is less than 1.0. The developers according to the present invention can prevent scumming during printing and simultaneously attain sufficient printing durability without impairment of image-forming performance, and the developer can dissolve or disperse stably for a long period of time the compounds which are not soluble in the developer, and therefore the running performance of the developer can be excellent and stabilized.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Methods for processing a group of accounts corresponding to different products

abstract.p: Processing a group of accounts corresponding to different products. A group of accounts are linked together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. Typically, a group includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders. Group level processing includes authorizing transactions, applying group payments, creating group statements, creating cardholder communications, and administering reward programs. Each dependent account has an associated dependent strategy that specifies group level processing options for the dependent account.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Creating groups of linked accounts

abstract.p: Linking accounts corresponding to different products together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. The group master data includes information about the group, including group parameters and a group identifier. A group typically includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationship between a dependent account and the group is specified by a dependent strategy. A dependent strategy specifies group level processing options for the account. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHOD FOR LINKING ACCOUNTS CORRESPONDING TO DIFFERENT PRODUCTS TOGETHER TO CREATE A GROUP
PROCEDE PERMETTANT DE RELIER DES COMPTES CORRESPONDANTS A DES PRODUITS DIFFERENTS AFIN DE CREER UN GROUPE

nplcit.text: No Search

abstract.p: Linking accounts corresponding to different products together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. The method links the accounts into a group by linking a financial record for each account to group master data for the group. The group master data includes information about the group, including group parameters and a group identifier. A group typically includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationship between a dependent account and the group is specified by a dependent strategy. A dependent strategy specifies group level processing options for the account. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders.

L'invention concerne un procédé permettant de relier des comptes correspondants à différents produits afin de créer un groupe, de sorte que le traitement de ce groupe peut s'exécuter au niveau groupe alors que le traitement indépendant des comptes s'exécute au niveau comptes. Ce procédé permet de regrouper les comptes en un groupe, par liaison de l'enregistrement financier correspondant à chaque compte aux données maîtres du groupe. Les données maîtres du groupe comprennent des informations relatives au groupe, des paramètres, et un identificateur de groupe. Un groupe comprend typiquement un compte-clé et un ou plusieurs comptes dépendants. La relation établie entre un compte dépendant et le groupe est spécifiée au moyen d'une stratégie dépendante. Cette stratégie dépendante spécifie des options de traitement de niveau groupe pour le compte.
La relation établie entre les comptes et le groupe est souple de façon à s'adapter aux changements de statut des détenteurs de carte.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHOD FOR LINKING ACCOUNTS CORRESPONDING TO DIFFERENT PRODUCTS TOGETHER TO CREATE A GROUP
PROCEDE PERMETTANT DE RELIER DES COMPTES CORRESPONDANTS A DES PRODUITS DIFFERENTS AFIN DE CREER UN GROUPE

abstract.p: L'invention concerne un procédé permettant de relier des comptes correspondants à différents produits afin de créer un groupe, de sorte que le traitement de ce groupe peut s'exécuter au niveau groupe alors que le traitement indépendant des comptes s'exécute au niveau comptes. Les données maîtres du groupe comprennent des informations relatives au groupe, des paramètres, et un identificateur de groupe. PROCEDES PERMETTANT DE DEFINIR UNE RELATION ENTRE UN COMPTE ET UN GROUPE

nplcit.text: No Search

abstract.p: Defining a relationship between an account and a group. Accounts corresponding to different products are linked together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. The relationship between a dependent account and the group is specified by a dependent strategy. A dependent strategy specifies group level processing options for the account. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders.

L'invention concerne des procédés permettant de définir une relation entre un compte et un groupe. Des comptes reliés à différents produits sont reliés afin de créer un groupe, de sorte que le traitement de groupe peut s'exécuter au niveau groupe, alors que le traitement indépendant des comptes s'exécute au niveau compte. La relation établie entre un compte dépendant et le groupe est spécifiée au moyen d'une stratégie dépendante. Cette stratégie dépendante spécifie les options de traitement de niveau groupe pour le compte. La relation établie entre les comptes et le groupe est souple afin de s'adapter aux changements d'état des détenteurs de carte du groupe.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHOD FOR DEFINING A RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN AN ACCOUNT AND A GROUP
PROCEDES PERMETTANT DE DEFINIR UNE RELATION ENTRE UN COMPTE ET UN GROUPE

abstract.p: L'invention concerne des procédés permettant de définir une relation entre un compte et un groupe. Des comptes reliés à différents produits sont reliés afin de créer un groupe, de sorte que le traitement de groupe peut s'exécuter au niveau groupe, alors que le traitement indépendant des comptes s'exécute au niveau compte. La relation établie entre un compte dépendant et le groupe est spécifiée au moyen d'une stratégie dépendante. Cette stratégie dépendante spécifie les options de traitement de niveau groupe pour le compte. La relation établie entre les comptes et le groupe est souple afin de s'adapter aux changements d'état des détenteurs de carte du groupe.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHODS FOR PROCESSING A GROUP OF ACCOUNTS CORRESPONDING TO DIFFERENT PRODUCTS
PROCEDES PERMETTANT DE TRAITER UN GROUPE DE COMPTES CORRESPONDANT A DIFFERENTS PRODUITS

nplcit.text: No Search

abstract.p: Processing a group of accounts corresponding to different products. A group of accounts are linked together to create a group so that group processing can be performed at the group level while independent processing of the accounts is performed at the account level. Typically, a group includes a key account and one or more dependent accounts. The relationships between the accounts and the group are flexible to accommodate changes in the status of the group cardholders. Group level processing includes authorizing transactions, applying group payments, creating group statements, creating cardholder communications, and administering reward programs. Each dependent account has an associated dependent strategy that specifies group level processing options for the dependent account.

L'invention concerne le traitement d'un groupe de comptes correspondant à différents produits. Elle concerne également un groupe de comptes reliés de façon à créer un groupe dont le traitement peut s'exécuter au niveau groupe, alors que le traitement indépendant des comptes s'exécute au niveau compte. Un groupe comprend généralement un compte-clé et un ou plusieurs comptes indépendants. La relation établie entre les comptes et le groupe est souple, afin de s'adapter aux changements d'état des détenteurs de carte de groupe. Le traitement au niveau groupe consiste à autoriser des transactions, à effectuer des paiements de groupe, à créer des relevés de compte de groupe, à établir des communications entre des détenteurs de carte, et à administrer des programmes de récompense.
Chaque groupe dépendant présente une stratégie dépendante associée, qui spécifie des options de traitement de niveau groupe pour le compte dépendant.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHODS FOR PROCESSING A GROUP OF ACCOUNTS CORRESPONDING TO DIFFERENT PRODUCTS
PROCEDES PERMETTANT DE TRAITER UN GROUPE DE COMPTES CORRESPONDANT A DIFFERENTS PRODUITS

abstract.p: L'invention concerne le traitement d'un groupe de comptes correspondant à différents produits. Elle concerne également un groupe de comptes reliés de façon à créer un groupe dont le traitement peut s'exécuter au niveau groupe, alors que le traitement indépendant des comptes s'exécute au niveau compte. Un groupe comprend généralement un compte-clé et un ou plusieurs comptes indépendants. La relation établie entre les comptes et le groupe est souple, afin de s'adapter aux changements d'état des détenteurs de carte de groupe. Le traitement au niveau groupe consiste à autoriser des transactions, à effectuer des paiements de groupe, à créer des relevés de compte de groupe, à établir des communications entre des détenteurs de carte, et à administrer des programmes de récompense.
Chaque groupe dépendant présente une stratégie dépendante associée, qui spécifie des options de traitement de niveau groupe pour le compte dépendant.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: MULTIPLE CREDIT LINE PRESENTATION INSTRUMENT
INSTRUMENT DE PRESENTATION DE LIGNES DE CREDIT MULTIPLES

abstract.p: The present invention provides systems and methods for consummating transactions realized using credit cards and other types of presentation instruments. The methods can include, inter alia, identifying a presentation instrument associated with a transaction request. Such a presentation instrument is associated with at least two underlying accounts, and it is determined the proportion in which to apply the amount of the transaction request to the underlying accounts. The systems can include various hardware and software used to implement this and other methods.

L'invention concerne des systèmes et des procédés de finalisation de transactions effectuées par carte de crédit et d'autres types d'instruments de présentation. Ces procédés peuvent consister notamment à identifier un instrument de présentation associé à une demande de transaction. Cet instrument de présentation est associé à au moins deux comptes sous-jacents. La proportion dans laquelle la somme de la demande de transaction doit être appliquée aux comptes sous-jacents est alors déterminée. Les systèmes peuvent comprendre plusieurs équipements matériel et logiciels utilisés pour mettre en oeuvre ce procédé ainsi que d'autres.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: MULTIPLE CREDIT LINE PRESENTATION INSTRUMENT
INSTRUMENT DE PRESENTATION DE LIGNES DE CREDIT MULTIPLES
